May 18, 2004 12:03 PM PDT Geico sues Google, Overture over trademarks By Stefanie Olsen Staff Writer, CNET News Auto insurance company Geico has sued Google and Overture Services for allegedly violating its trademarks in search-related advertisements, in the latest legal salvo against the Internet companies. Geico, a subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway, the investment company owned by Warren Buffett, filed suit against Google and Yahoo-owned Overture on May 4, in federal court in Alexandria, Va. The insurer charged the two companies with infringing on its trademarks when they sold them as keywords to Geico's rivals, so that the protected terms could appear in sponsored search results. According to the suit, that practice causes consumer confusion, in violation of the Lanham Act, the primary federal law covering trademark registration and protection.

The following case in 2004 is another INDICATION that Google was CLEARLY AWARE of IMPORTNCE of the TRADEMARK when filed for trademarking ON2's HANTRO on April 2, 2008, about a month prior to ON2 and Sun-Microsystem announcement of their strategic partnership on May 7, 2008. How could ON2's BOD and management blindly ignore the importance of this google act or claim that they did not know? Why ON2 did NOT trademark Hantro instead of keeping ON2 shareholders for MONTHs with which LOGO would be good for VP8? Was vP8 logo a scam to prolong ON2's VP8 SDKs releasing to different developers? Message.Title: The Countdown to October 16 Begins for Vringo and Google !
Message.Msg: There are less than two months left until Vringo (NYSE: VRNG [FREE Stock Trend Analysis]) and Google (NASDAQ: GOOG) go head-to-head in court. Once a forgotten penny stock stuck in application development operations, Vringo has emerged as a $200 million company largely due to its lawsuit threats against Google and other search engines like AOL (NYSE: AOL). On October 16, 2012, Vringo will finally reach a long-anticipated legal hearing when it will try to convince the court that Google has infringed upon its patented search technology worth "billions of dollars." The trial will take place in the Eastern District Court of Norfolk, Virginia. Many Vringo invesors are hoping for a quick, out-of-court settlement, including James Altucher, managing director of Formula Capital. Altucher famously penned his first article on the Vringo-Google lawsuit on March 31, sparking a 200% rally in shares of the otherwise forgotten patent troll. Since his article, Vringo has oscillated between $3-4 per share, with Altucher explaining that he continues to hold his shares in anticipation of a large settlement from Google. On August 6, AOL settled with Vringo's I/P Engine in the same court. The settlement noted, "On this day, I/P Engine, Inc. and AOL Inc. announced to the Court that they have settled I/P Engine's claims against AOL relating to AOL's Advertising.com Sponsored Listings." The final dollar amount of this AOL settlement has not been disclosed. Read more: benzinga
I don't see them ever splitting

Topic.Title: Yahoo msg board: feature or bug?

Message.Msg: Here is what I think might be one of the "problem." Usually Yahoo displays the last Message posted on each thread as the 1st one on the list based on the least timestampped on the message. But what their "algorithm" is doing now is thay Yahoo tool displaying the messages on each thread based on FIRST-IN and LAST-OUT Message-Timestam instead of LAST-IN and FIRST-OUT order. Since the distortion ofr delaying timstammed messages also happened a few times before, I am nOT sure what the intention of Yahoo admin from these scheme/scam or bug/feature is? How coulsd it be possible these kind of thing happen unless there is something WRONG in some way and Yahoo admin is TRYING to HIDE from those trying to look into the messages thread on their Yahoo Messages Board? I really do nOT know how their tool works but those bugs/feature in FIRST-IN and LAST-OUT is so obvious to be ignored!!!! So, if you want to post under the "old" message thred, your message will NOT be displayed on front page if the timestamp is old enough to be on the next Page?

Topic.Title: Yahoo msg board: feature or bug?

Message.Msg: I know this is not the place to post the messages this way but what can I do when yahoo is trying to srewup its own board. Is it because the CRIMINAL agents being EXPOSED or they have bug in their product I would NOT know what to say: it is first-in-first-out not first-in and last-out that yahoo doing at this moment But what their "algorithm" is doing now is thay Yahoo tool displaying the messages on each thread based on FIRST-IN and FIRST-OUT Message-Timestampped, instead of LAST-IN and FIRST-OUT order. For example, if the first timestampped of a message was say 2 hours ago and last massage on the same message-thread was 2 minutes ago and there was another messages in different threads with 10, 30 minutes and one hour timestampped, the message with two minutes timestamp on the thread with timestamp-2-hour-ago should be displayed first but it is not happening.
